availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Ephraim C. Morgan (Greenup County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Greenup County, Kentucky, farmer. Ohio native. Son of John Morgan and Mary Shaw Morgan. Married to Eliza Farmer Morgan on December 20, 1855. Father of John S. Morgan, Mary E. Morgan, William H. Morgan, and Catherine Morgan. Farmer in Scioto County, Ohio, in 1850. Farmer in Greenup County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Scioto County, Jefferson, p. 124. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, p. 116. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, Precinct 2, p. 12. Scioto County, Ohio Marriages, 1851-60, Portsmouth, Ohio, accessed via Jordan Dodd, comp., Ohio, Marriages, 1803-1900, Ancestry. Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates â€“ Microfilm (1911-1964), Greenup County, 1913, no. 1265, Microfilm rolls #7016130-7041803, Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, Kentucky.
